review: 2 stars for how small and convenient it is, plus Prime integration. For the price it's the best option, however, the connectivity issues make it disappoint. I've been using a PS3 for my streaming needs and never have a network problem. The Fire stick almost always gives me an error about no internet connection and whenever I check my settings, it says strong signal but "connected with problems". It's plugged into the HDMI extender and the power outlet. Unless there's an update sometime soon, I'm not getting any use out of it :( I've gone back to the PS3.
author: Virginia Shammas

review: I received this as a gift and I'm very impressed. I have a Blu-Ray player that streams Netflix, but it's very spotty with WiFi - I have no trouble with the Fire TV Stick. There are a lot of entertainment options and it works very well. I highly recommend.

review: Amazon's web site states that Fire Stick's can mirror the display of devices running Android 4.2 or higher, (amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=201636640).However, I have been unable to get screen mirroring to operate with my Samsung Galaxy S5 (running Android 4.4.4).Both devices see & recognize each other over the network, and they begin the screen mirroring process, but it never completes.Following Amazon's troubleshooting suggestions (http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=201636520) failed to resolve the problem.  Upon contacting Amazon's Technical Support, I was advised that it was a Samsung problem, and I should get in touch with them.Based on this experience, owners of Samsung Android devices may experience difficulties when attempting to use the screen mirroring capabilities of the Fire Stick.Update: I experienced exactly the same problem with the Fire Stick & a Samsung Tab S 10.5, currently running Android Kit Kat 4.4.2.
